intro: Crotalaria ringoetii, commonly known as the ringoet's crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It has hairy stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Crotalaria ringoetii is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and its potential use in traditional medicine.
